sub_title: Scientist and Research Theme Coordinator at Maastricht University
summary:
My ambition is to work in an inspiring environment and with an enthusiastic team. To keep up with the latest developments and maintaining and developing external contacts. To supervise and manage projects. I enjoy working in an interdisciplinary environment. I am conceptually strong, reliable, aware of my surroundings and have an eye for detail.

I’m always looking for concrete results in the form of actual application in my work. I can apply an engineering approach when needed. I love working with data. Biomedical signals for one, but also data in general. trying to reveal what is in there. A good sense for what is happening in my surrounding is important to me. Not only socially, but also to ensure that matters in the department go smoothly. I actively cooperate with the industry and have an interest in actual product development.

awards.title: Clinical Needs Translational Award
awards.description:
This award programme is designed to encourage participation of multidisciplinary research teams, with emphasis on the potential clinical applicability and impact of the research.

Details of previous recipients of the award:

 	
 2016:

Matthijs Cluitmans (Maastricht)*, Jaume Coll-Font, Burak Erem, Dana Brooks, Pietro Bonizzi, Joël Karel, Paul Volders, Ralf Peeters and Ronald Westra “Spatiotemporal Activation Time Estimation Improves Noninvasive Localization of Cardiac Electrical Activity”.
awards.issuer: Working Group on e-Cardiology of the European Society of Cardiology (ESC) and CinC

projects.title: Bio-Marker Discovery: Predicting Response to Therapy in Heart Failure by Using a Multiple Biomarker Panel
projects.description:
This project aims at discovering multiple biomarker panels from heart-patient data using data-mining techniques. The final goal is to predict individual outcome and to define therapy beneficial for individual heart patients.
Keywords: survival analysis, multiple regression, biomarkers

profile_positions.description:
Coordinating research theme on Signals, Complex Systems and Images (SCSI)
Supervising 3 PhD students
Involved in a ECSEL Joint undertaking funded by the European Union
profile_positions.title: Associate Professor

profile_positions.description: Team leader for the Signals, Systems and Images team
profile_positions.title: Research Theme Coordinator

profile_positions.description: Responsible for deciding whether students comply with the education and examination regulations, issues sanctions in cases of nonconformity according to the Dutch Higher Education Act, ensures the quality of the exams, appoints examiners, establishes exam results and issues certificates.
profile_positions.title: Chair of the Board of Examiners

profile_positions.description:
Universitair docent 2 (2008), universitair docent 1 (2015).
I just love to work on actual problems. As a result in my research I cooperate with clinical partners and Industry. My research interests are: BioMedical Signal and Image Processing, time-frequency analysis, Data science, Data Analysis, Curvelets, ECGi, Wavelet Theory, Wavelet Design, Systems Theory, Survival analysis, Causality analysis and Sparsity.
Responsibilities are: Supervising Postdocs, PhD Students, thesis students and projects. As chair of program committee responsible for quality and policy regarding education. Coordinator for signal processing research. Developing and maintaining research contacts with hospitals and industry and project acquisition.
Education: Lecturer for Calculus (UCM), Mathematical Modeling, Capita Selecta Knowledge Engineering, Simulation (MOR), Mathematical Simulation, Data Analysis, Signal and Image Processing. Developer of couse on Signal and Image Processing, Simulation (MOR), co-developed course on Stochastic Decision Making and Data Analysis
Together with Frank Thuijsman I'm coordinating KE@work where our best students in the second and third year of the Bachelor follow a dual program where they work two years at a company while studying, gaining valuable experience. Together we contact companies and match students
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor (tenured)

profile_positions.description: The program committee is overseeing the quality and curriculum of one bachelor program and two master programs. The chairman takes initiative and guides together with the director of studies the process of introducing policy changes that are suggested by the program committee.
profile_positions.title: Chair of the Program Committee

profile_positions.description: Setting up the new high performance computing cluster of the Department of Data Science and Knowledge Engineering in collaboration with the IT Center of the RWTH Aachen University and Dell. This is a CPU and GPU cluster for optimisation, machine learning and deep learning
profile_positions.title: Coordinator ICT High Performance Computing

profile_positions.description: Lectures for bachelor knowledge engineering and master programme in operations research. Research in biomedical signal processing. External research contacts
profile_positions.title: Lecturer

profile_positions.description:
Worked for the Maastricht University on the Biosens project towards completion of the PhD thesis entitled: "A wavelet approach to cardiac signal processing for low-power hardware applications". 
Topics were signal processing, time-frequency analysis, wavelet analysis, data analysis, ultra-low power implementation, linear systems theory, Matlab implementation, C++ implementation and classification
The research was embedded in the STW funded BioSens project. A cooperation of the Delft University of Technology and the Maastricht University. The users' committee consisted of Medtronic Bakken Research Center in Maastricht, Medtronic Subcutaneous Diagnostics and Monitoring in Arnhem, Twente Medical Systems International, Maastricht Instruments, SystematIC Design B.V. and Weijand R&D Consultancy B.V.
During this time I was a teaching assistant for various courses such as datamining, mathematical modeling and mathematical simulation
profile_positions.title: Ph.D. student

profile_positions.description: Part-time position involving research in simulation and scheduling
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.description: C++ developer of simulation software and engine, consulting, customer contact and modeling.
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer

profile_positions.description: Conduction research on atrial fibrillation at the Medtronic Bakken Research Center, department of advanced concepts
profile_positions.title: Trainee

profile_positions.description: Administration and IT in our family business; an art gallery. This was a teenager a great learning experience. Was involved in almost everything. Designing brochures, IT, tax declarations, sales.
profile_positions.title: Administrator and IT
